episodeTitle: History's Strongest Collaboration vs. Glutton of the Sea
episodeTitleJapanese: 史上最強コラボVS海の大食漢
episodeTitleRomanized: Shijō Saikyō Korabo tai Umi no Taishokukan
description: A special crossover episode featuring characters from One Piece, Toriko, and Dragon Ball Z. The heroes participate in an IGO food tournament that turns into a battle against Akami, a deep-sea glutton that drains life energy from its victims.

events.title: IGO Food Tournament Begins
events.description: The International Gourmet Organization hosts a Food Tournament with no rules on a special island. The prize is the rare Carat Sizzled Cattle, attracting competitors from three different universes including the Straw Hat Pirates, Goku's family, and Toriko's group.
events.significance: Sets up the crossover event and brings together characters from three major anime franchises for the first time in this special.

events.title: Three Routes Split
events.description: The tournament competitors arrive at a crossroads and split up between three different routes: mountain, desert, and forest. Various side adventures occur as different character groups navigate their chosen paths.
events.significance: Creates opportunities for character interactions across the three franchises and showcases different fighting styles and abilities.

events.title: Three-Way Finish Line Battle
events.description: Luffy, Toriko, and Goku reach the finish line simultaneously and grab the goal flag at the same time. This instigates a three-way battle between the protagonists for victory, with each showing off their signature abilities.
events.significance: Historic moment where three of Jump's most iconic protagonists face off against each other in combat.

events.title: Mr. Satan Wins by Default
events.description: As Goku, Luffy, and Toriko battle fiercely, they accidentally destroy the tournament ring and knock themselves out of bounds. Mr. Satan, who had been knocked onto the battlefield earlier, ends up being the only one still standing and wins the tournament by default.
events.significance: A comedic resolution to the three-way battle that pays homage to Mr. Satan's character trait of accidentally winning through others' actions.

events.title: Tournament's True Purpose Revealed
events.description: IGO Director Mansam reveals the shocking truth: the tournament was not actually about the prize, but was designed to lure out a Deep Sea Glutton creature called Akami, which sucks out the energy of living things. The gathered warriors were meant to help capture it.
events.significance: Transforms the episode from a simple competition into a cooperative battle against a common enemy, uniting all three franchises.

events.title: Akami Appears and Attacks
events.description: The Deep Sea Glutton Akami emerges and immediately attacks Mr. Satan, Usopp, and Gohan, draining their energy and growing larger. The creature demonstrates its dangerous ability to absorb life force from its victims.
events.significance: Introduces the main antagonist of the special and establishes the threat level that will require all three protagonists to work together.

events.title: Akami Evolves After Draining Multiple Fighters
events.description: Sanji, Brook, Franky, Sunny, Coco, Piccolo, Goten, and Trunks all attempt to attack Akami but have their energy drained as well. The absorbed energy allows Akami to evolve into a much more powerful form with enhanced abilities.
events.significance: Demonstrates that conventional attacks won't work and that the heroes need a different strategy to defeat this evolving threat.

events.title: Luffy, Toriko, and Goku Unite Against Akami
events.description: The three main protagonists find and attack Akami together, impressed by each other's fighting skills. However, their combined attacks prove unsuccessful as Akami can now absorb the power of any attack thrown at it, requiring an even more powerful strategy.
events.significance: Historic collaboration between three of Shonen Jump's most iconic protagonists working as a team for the first time.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Elephant Gatling
events.description: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Elephant Gatling, a Gear Third technique, to help distract Akami while Goku charges his Spirit Bomb. The powerful stretching attack demonstrates Luffy's post-timeskip abilities in this crossover context.
events.significance: Showcases Luffy's advanced Gear Third techniques to audiences from other franchises and contributes to the final combined attack.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy unleashes his Gear Third attack to help defeat Akami

events.title: Combined Ultimate Attack Defeats Akami
events.description: Goku requests that everyone at the tournament lend their energy to his Spirit Bomb. The three heroes then unleash a devastating combined attack: Elephant Gatling (Luffy), Twin Kugi Punch (Toriko), Kamehameha (Goku), and the Spirit Bomb, all hitting Akami simultaneously and defeating it.
events.significance: The climax of the crossover special, showing true cooperation between three anime universes to defeat a common enemy with their signature ultimate techniques.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's contribution to the final combined attack against Akami

themes.description: The episode emphasizes how even the strongest individuals need to work together to overcome challenges. Characters from three different universes must unite their strengths to defeat a common enemy.
themes.symbolism: The combined final attack represents the power of cooperation across different worlds and fighting styles.
culturalReferences: Weekly Shonen Jump's legacy of promoting friendship and teamwork as core values

themes.description: The tournament setup showcases the competitive nature of all three protagonists, but ultimately shows that competition can give way to cooperation when facing a greater threat.
themes.symbolism: The transition from competing for meat to fighting together symbolizes maturity and prioritizing the greater good.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his post-timeskip abilities and shows his capacity to work with other powerful fighters from different worlds. His cheerful personality and love for food make him a natural fit for the IGO tournament setting.
keyActions: Reaches finish line simultaneously with Toriko and Goku
Battles alongside Toriko and Goku against Akami
Uses Gomu Gomu no Elephant Gatling in the final attack

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-original and does not appear in the One Piece manga. It is a special crossover created specifically for the anime to celebrate Toriko's second anniversary.

trivia.fact: Episode 590 is part of the Dream 9: Toriko x One Piece x Dragon Ball Z Super Collaboration Special, which aired on April 7, 2013, to celebrate the Toriko anime's second anniversary.
This is the only One Piece episode that was never released on home video due to complex licensing rights involving three different anime properties.

sources.title: Why Has One Piece Episode 590 Only Aired Once?

trivia.fact: The episode was the last to use 'We Go!' by Hiroshi Kitadani, though it was used as an ending theme rather than the opening theme for this special episode.
The English dub of this episode didn't air until March 4, 2023, on Cartoon Network's Toonami - nearly 10 years after the original Japanese broadcast.

sources.title: 10 Years Later, Dragon Ball, One Piece, Toriko Crossover Episode Gets English Dub Release

trivia.fact: Christopher R. Sabat voiced three different characters in the English dub: Roronoa Zoro, Vegeta, and Piccolo.

sources.title: Dream 9 Toriko ✕ One Piece ✕ Dragon Ball Z Super Crossover Special!! - Anime Voice-Over Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode received a TV rating of 8.3% in Japan, ranking 3rd in viewership for its timeslot.
This was the third animated crossover between One Piece and Toriko, following two previous collaboration specials.

sources.title: Toriko Collaboration Specials/Toriko x One Piece x DBZ - Toriko Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode became available on Netflix in North America and Latin America in November 2024, marking the first time it was available on a major streaming platform in those regions.

sources.title: A Forgotten Anime Crossover Is Finally Coming to Netflix
